'''Jonathan Castro Otto''' (born 3 March 1994), commonly known as '''Jonny''', is a Spanish professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays for [[Premier League]] club [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] as a [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|right or left back]].
He began his career with [[RC Celta de Vigo|Celta]], making his debut with the first team at the age of 18 and going on to appear in 221 matches across all competitions. In 2018 he signed with [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]], initially on loan.
Jonny made his senior debut for [[Spain national football team|Spain]] in 2018.
==Club career== ===Celta=== Born in [[Vigo]], [[Galicia, Spain|Galicia]], Jonny played youth football with his hometown club [[RC Celta de Vigo]]. He spent [[2011–12 Segunda División B|his first season]] as a senior with [[Celta de Vigo B|the reserves]] in [[Segunda División B]], appearing regularly but suffering team relegation.
Jonny made his [[La Liga]] debut for the main squad on 1 September 2012, starting in a 2–0 home win against [[CA Osasuna]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://espnfc.com/uk/en/report/348483/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=5739|title=First win for Celta|publisher=[[ESPN FC]]|date=1 September 2012|accessdate=9 November 2012}}</ref> On 5 November, he renewed his contract with the club until 2017.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://futbol.as.com/futbol/2012/11/05/primera/1352146633_909388.html|title=Borja Oubiña renueva y Túñez y Jonny amplían su contrato|trans-title=Borja Oubiña renews and Túñez and Jonny extend their contracts|newspaper=[[Diario AS]]|language=Spanish|date=5 November 2012|accessdate=24 March 2015}}</ref>
Jonny was definitely promoted to the first team at the start of [[2013–14 La Liga|2013–14]] after the arrival of [[Luis Enrique (footballer)|Luis Enrique]] as coach, and appeared in 26 matches during that campaign. On 19 January 2015, he further extended his link until 2019.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.celtavigo.net/es/primer-equipo/noticias/8701-el-canterano-jonny-castro-celeste-hasta-2019|title=El canterano Jonny Castro, celeste hasta 2019|trans-title=Youth player Jonny Castro, sky blue until 2019|publisher=Celta Vigo|language=Spanish|date=19 January 2015|accessdate=24 March 2015|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150403010244/http://www.celtavigo.net/es/primer-equipo/noticias/8701-el-canterano-jonny-castro-celeste-hasta-2019|archivedate=3 April 2015|df=}}</ref>
Jonny scored his first professional goal on 20 February 2016, netting the second in a 3–2 home success over [[SD Eibar]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.eitb.eus/es/deportes/futbol/eibar/detalle/3853454/liga-bbva--celtaeibar-32-derrota-armera-balaidos/|title=El Eibar pierde el duelo por Europa ante el Celta|trans-title=Eibar lose duel for Europe against Celta|publisher=[[EITB]]|language=Spanish|date=20 February 2016|accessdate=31 May 2016}}</ref> He finished [[2015–16 La Liga|the season]] with 36 league appearances, helping the side finish sixth and [[2016–17 UEFA Europa League|qualify]] to the [[UEFA Europa League]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://eldesmarque.com/vigo/celta/noticias/4351-jonny-llega-a-los-150-partidos-oficiales|title=Jonny llega a los 150 partidos oficiales|trans-title=Jonny reaches 150 official matches|publisher=El Desmarque|last=Bravo|first=Alberto|language=Spanish|date=12 December 2016|accessdate=31 January 2019}}</ref>
On 18 January 2017, Jonny scored the 2–1 winner away against [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]] in [[2016–17 Copa del Rey|the quarter-finals]] of the [[Copa del Rey]] (eventual 4–3 aggregate triumph).<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38640258|title=Real Madrid 1–2 Celta Vigo|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|date=18 January 2017|accessdate=19 January 2017}}</ref>
===Wolverhampton Wanderers=== On 25 July 2018, Jonny joined [[Atlético Madrid]] for an undisclosed fee, signing a six-year contract. He then immediately joined English club [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] on a [[2018–19 Premier League|season]]-long loan.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://en.atleticodemadrid.com/noticias/agreement-with-celta-de-vigo-over-the-transfer-of-jonny|title=Agreement with Celta de Vigo over the transfer of Jonny|publisher=Atlético Madrid|date=25 July 2018|accessdate=25 July 2018}}</ref> His maiden appearance in the [[Premier League]] took place on 11 August, when he played the entire 2–2 home draw against [[Everton F.C.|Everton]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/45067374|title=Wolverhampton Wanderers 2–2 Everton|publisher=BBC Sport|last=Hafez|first=Shamoon|date=11 August 2018|accessdate=14 August 2018}}</ref>
Jonny scored his first league goal on 29 September 2018, in a 2–0 home victory over [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45610318|title=Wolverhampton Wanderers 2–0 Southampton|publisher=BBC Sport|last=Poole|first=Harry|date=29 September 2018|accessdate=30 September 2018}}</ref> On 18 November, he suffered a knee [[ligament]] injury while playing for [[Spain national football team|Spain]], being initially sidelined until the end of the year<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.expressandstar.com/sport/football/wolverhampton-wanderers-fc/2018/11/19/wolves-jonny-castro-otto-sidelined-for-up-to-six-weeks/|title=Wolves' Jonny Castro Otto sidelined for up to six weeks|newspaper=[[Express & Star]]|last=Spiers|first=Tim|date=19 November 2018|accessdate=25 November 2018}}</ref> but recovering a few weeks later.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.shropshirestar.com/sport/football/wolverhampton-wanderers-fc/2018/12/17/nuno-delighted-with-jonny-castro-ottos-swift-wolves-recovery/|title=Nuno delighted with Jonny Castro Otto's swift Wolves recovery|newspaper=[[Shropshire Star]]|last=Edwards|first=Joe|date=17 December 2018|accessdate=30 January 2019}}</ref>
Having been a regular first-team player during the first half of the campaign, Jonny agreed to a permanent four-and-a-half-year deal at [[Molineux Stadium|Molineux]] on 31 January 2019 for an undisclosed fee, reported to be £15 million.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/47069484|title=Jonny Castro Otto: Wolves complete £15m deal with Atletico Madrid|publisher=BBC Sport|last=Stone|first=Simon|date=31 January 2019|accessdate=31 January 2019}}</ref>
==International career== After playing for [[Spain national football team|Spain]] at [[Spain national under-18 football team|under-18]], [[Spain national under-19 football team|under-19]], [[Spain national under-20 football team|under-20]] and [[Spain national under-21 football team|under-21 levels]], Jonny was called up to the full side on 26 May 2015, for a [[Exhibition game|friendly]] with [[Costa Rica national football team|Costa Rica]] and a [[UEFA Euro 2016]] [[UEFA Euro 2016 qualifying|qualifier]] against [[Belarus national football team|Belarus]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.celtavigo.net/es/club/noticias/9230-jonny-y-nolito-representan-al-celta-en-la-seleccion-espanola|title=Jonny y Nolito representan al Celta en la Selección Española|trans-title=Jonny and Nolito represent Celta at the Spanish national team|publisher=Celta Vigo|language=Spanish|date=26 May 2015|accessdate=7 September 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150923060433/http://www.celtavigo.net/es/club/noticias/9230-jonny-y-nolito-representan-al-celta-en-la-seleccion-espanola|archive-date=23 September 2015|dead-url=yes|df=}}</ref> He did not take part in any of those matches, however.
Jonny won his first [[Cap (sport)|cap]] for his country on 11 October 2018, contributing to a 4–1 friendly defeat of [[Wales national football team|Wales]] at the [[Millennium Stadium]] after coming on as a 63rd-minute [[Substitute (association football)|substitute]] for [[César Azpilicueta]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/report?gameId=510031|title=Paco Alcacer scores twice as dominant Spain demolish Wales in Cardiff|publisher=[[ESPN]]|date=11 October 2018|accessdate=12 October 2018}}</ref>
